content:
Jonathan: We can't control how others respond, Damian. But we can control our own actions and ask for forgiveness with sincerity and love. And then, we can trust that God will work things out for the best.

Damian: (nodding slowly) I want to make things right, but I don’t know how.

Jonathan: (smiling) Damian, I'm proud of you for wanting to do the right thing. And I’m here to support you.

Damian: (hesitant) But John, there's something you need to know. The thing I did… I killed my cousin when I was younger. He can’t forgive me – he’s dead. And I don't know how to live with the guilt and the pain.

Jonathan: (shocked) Whoa. I didn’t know that. But there's no sin too big for God to forgive, Damian. I believe that with all my heart. And I believe that Jesus can transform our hearts and desires, so that we don't want to sin anymore.

Damian: (skeptical) But how does that work? How can God change us like that?

Jonathan: (explaining) Well, when we repent of our sins, He gives us the Holy Spirit to guide us and help us. And He also gives us a new heart and a new desire to live for Him and do what's right.

Damian: (thoughtful) That sounds too good to be true.

Jonathan: (smiling) I know it does. But I believe it because I've experienced it myself. He can do amazing things in us and through us.

Damian: (nodding slowly) Okay, John. I think I understand. Even my cousin can’t forgive me, and I don’t know if I can forgive myself, but I’m willing to ask God for forgiveness.

Jonathan: (gentle) That's okay, Damian. But I believe that Jesus is the only one who can truly forgive us and heal us. And I believe that He loves you, no matter what.

Damian: (thoughtful) I see. But what if I mess up again?

Jonathan: (gentle) We all mess up, Damian. But that's why we need Jesus.
